{{http://www.via.com.tw/en/images/products/mainboards/pico_itx/epia-p820/epia-p820.jpg}}

'''''~+Ubuntu 10.10 Maverick Meerkat+~'''''

== Video ==

<pre>
user@box:~$ lspci | grep VGA
00:01.0 VGA compatible controller: VIA Technologies, Inc. VX855/VX875 Chrome 9 HCM Integrated Graphics
</pre>

=== Grub2 ===
edit GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT in file /etc/default/grub to set VIA framebuffer

<pre>
GRUB_CMDLINE_LINUX_DEFAULT="splash quiet video=viafb:viafb_mode=800x600,viafb_bpp=32,viafb_refresh=60"
</pre>

add the following line to the end of file

/etc/grub.d/40_custom

<pre>
set gfxterm_font="20"
set gfxmode="800x600x32"
set gfxpayload="800x600x32"
insmod gfxterm
insmod vbe
insmod tga
terminal_output gfxterm
</pre>

then update grub

<pre>
sudo update-grub2
</pre>

=== Open Chrome ===

<nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/EpiaP820?action=AttachFile&do=get&target=xorg.conf-openchrome|Example xorg.conf file]]</nowiki>

Set Driver value under Device to "openchrome"
<pre>
Section "Device"
  Identifier  "Card0"
  Driver      "openchrome"
  BusID       "PCI:0:1:0"
EndSection
</pre>

OpenChrome Device options of note:

needed for setting resolution, adjust to the size you need
<pre>
        Option     "VBEModes" "true"
        Option     "PanelSize"   "800x600"
        Option     "ForcePanel" "true"
</pre>

Missing mouse cursor
<pre>
       Option     "SWCursor"        "true"
</pre>

https://help.ubuntu.com/community/OpenChrome#VIA%20proprietary%20graphics%20driver

=== Vesa ===
Set Driver value under Device to "vesa"
<pre>
Section "Device"
  Identifier  "Card0"
  Driver      "vesa"
  BusID       "PCI:0:1:0"
EndSection
</pre>

== Audio ==

<pre>
user@box:~$ lspci | grep -i audio
00:14.0 Audio device: VIA Technologies, Inc. VT1708/A [Azalia HDAC] (VIA High Definition Audio Controller) (rev 20)
</pre>

=== No Sound ===

There is a submitted bug pertaining to kernel module snd_hda_codec_via

https://bugzilla.kernel.org/show_bug.cgi?id=14976

Currently a workaround is to blacklist the module, until the issue is resolved.

<pre>
echo "echo \"blacklist snd_hda_codec_via\" >> /etc/modprobe.d/blacklist.conf" | sudo bash
</pre>
